page.title: 11THINGS TO WORRY ABOUT
page.content: Since the old people's bungalows and flats were built, there are increasing numbers of people over 80. There is concern for their welfare. The District Council have been asked to provide a warden. They have refused. Many are concerned that the price of houses prevents young couples with children moving into the area which means that the number of children at the village school is decreasing. Dogs, out of the 154 dogs in the village, fouling the footways concern those interested in health. There are constantly calls for a speed limit through the village. Some people would like street lighting. There is always a worry about the dumping of household and builders' rubbish on farmland and in gateways. A guide to the footpaths has been published because concern was felt that they were being lost.
